channel.title: G. Willow Wilson on jverkamp.com
channel.description: Recent content in G. Willow Wilson on jverkamp.com

item.title: Ms. Marvel, Vol. 6: Civil War II
item.description:
High school athletic competition! New Jersey vs New York! Kamala vs…

Miles? Oh my.

Haven’t seen him for a while…

So that went well.

item.title: Ms. Marvel, Vol. 5: Super Famous
item.description:
And… swap. Continued volume numbering, new issue numbers. Same writer, new artists.

Onward!

Whoa, wait a minute. Less onward. More context!

Okay, so six months have passed. And it’s not just we the readers who missed everything—apparently Kamala’s been flaking hard as well.

lol.

Also, Tyesha!

Which makes everything even more super busy! So of course…

Yup. Bad idea.

So good.

item.title: Ms. Marvel, Vol. 4: Last Days
item.description:
The world… is ending.

Or at least that’s how it feels.

Didn’t she know him for like… a couple days? I suppose it’s not that unusual. First times are so much bigger.

But still.

Bigger problems.

Also, the dream team up!

It’s fun and exactly the sort of thing Kamala dreamt about! Even if the scale of it all… doesn’t really make sense. The end of the world looms and they’re starting with the looting?

But getting to the part of the story we saw in the show? “I know.” That’s the story I’m interested in!

A chaotic delightful mess of a story.

item.title: Ms. Marvel, Vol. 3: Crushed
item.description:
…

Well. As far as hooks go, that is most certainly one of them.

Pity it’s only got one volume.

Other than that we get the introduction of Kamran—instant meetcute with Kamala, what can possibly go wrong—inhuman strife, and… a S.H.I.E.L.D. crossover?

Looks fun. Maybe I’ll read that one next.

Anyways, everything feels like it’s flying by, in the way of comics. It takes too long to illustrate an entire volume, so everything gets crammed together.

Onward!

item.title: Ms. Marvel, Vol. 2: Generation Why
item.description:
You know all those rumors about pet alligators flushed down the sewers?

Yeah, they generally fail to mention the freakin laser beams.

Comics are weird. Volume 2 and we’re already with the crossovers (hallucinatory Avengers don’t count). So many crossovers. But they’re cute! And it’s still mostly Ms. Marvel calling the shots.

A solid volume 2! Onward!

item.title: Ms. Marvel, Vol. 1: No Normal
item.description:
Ms. Marvel! I watched the TV show, so this should be about the same right?

Right?

Well… things get weird. Mostly due to an origin not entirely in the movies. So it’s a bit different.

But the feel?

It’s still street level, teen girl, dealing with being from a Pakistani family/Muslim born in America.

It’s a fun start!
